data.name: Venusaur-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jungle Hammer
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: M Venusaur-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crisis Vine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: It is covered with a green skin. When it grows, it sheds the skin, covers itself with silk, and becomes a cocoon.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is in a temporary stage while making its body. It is almost completely unable to move on its own.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Blue plant vines cloak the Pokémon's identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swarming Sting
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage times the number of Beedrill you have in play to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard
data.flavorText: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: All Energy attached to this Pokémon are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.

data.name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: Very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.

attacks.name: Hind Kick
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Ninetales BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Explosive Fireball
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that is described in Chinese legends. It is said to race at an unbelievable speed.

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, you may move any number of Fire Energy attached to your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Breath
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: Its body is light, and its legs are incredibly powerful. It can clear Ayers Rock in one leap.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.

data.name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: M Blastoise-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Bombard
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.flavorText: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: M Slowbro-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Loll Roll Spin
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused. During your next turn, this Pokémon's Loll Roll Spin attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Poliwrath
data.flavorText: An adept swimmer, it knows the front crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster than the best human swimmers.

attacks.name: Dashing Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Slowbro-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Dewgong
data.flavorText: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.

attacks.name: Super Deep Dive
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Starmie BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Starmie BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Break Star
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon BREAK. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a geometric body. Because of its body, the locals suspect that it is an alien creature.

abilities.name: Space Beacon
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this Ability.)

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its electric charges can reach even 100,000 volts. Careless contact can cause even an Indian elephant to faint.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spark Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: A life-form whose identity is unknown. It is said to Screech or suddenly Self-Destruct.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

abilities.name: Buzzap Thunder
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out this Pokémon and attach it to one of your Lightning Pokémon as a Special Energy card. This card provides 2 Lightning Energy only while this card is attached to a Pokémon.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. While it is flying, it makes crackling and snapping sounds.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Nidoking
data.flavorText: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn as it contains venom.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tail Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It is easily angered. By swinging its well-developed horn wildly, it can even punch through diamond.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: A descendant of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.flavorText: A Pokémon whose genetic code was repeatedly recombined for research. It turned vicious as a result.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon. If 1 of your Pokémon used Barrier during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Nidoking BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Nidoking BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Toxic Drill
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: A being that exists as a thin gas. It can topple an Indian elephant by enveloping the prey in two seconds.

attacks.name: Little Grudge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, discard an Energy attached to the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Regeneration
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mew
data.flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

abilities.name: Neutral Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Evolution Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Sandshrew
data.flavorText: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Dig Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: Its adorable appearance makes it popular as a pet. However, it is rare and difficult to find.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Machamp
data.flavorText: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Machamp BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Machamp BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Boomerang Lariat
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this Pokémon. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.

abilities.name: Mischievous Fang
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Pidgeot-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feather Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: M Pidgeot-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Cyclone
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Raticate
data.flavorText: Its rear feet have three toes each. They are webbed, enabling it to swim across rivers.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadowy Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage times the number of Special Energy cards in your opponent's discard pile.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Leek Slap during your next turn.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Dragonite-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pull Up
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 2 Basic Pokémon (except for Dragonite-EX) from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Blastoise Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Blastoise-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: Using the most advanced technologies, scientists finally succeeded in making the first artificial Pokémon.

attacks.name: Conversion 3
attacks.text: Choose Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, Fighting, Darkness, Metal, Fairy, or Dragon type. The Defending Pokémon's Weakness is now that type until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Charizard Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Charizard-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Devolution Spray
rules: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Maintenance
rules: Shuffle 2 cards from your hand into your deck. (If you can't shuffle 2 cards into your deck, you can't play this card.) Then, draw a card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Misty's Determination
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokédex
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pidgeot Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Pidgeot-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Slowbro Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Slowbro-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Oak's Hint
rules: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Revive
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Super Potion
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Venusaur Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Venusaur-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

data.name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: M Venusaur-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crisis Vine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: M Blastoise-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Bombard
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pidgeot-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feather Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Regeneration
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: M Pidgeot-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Cyclone
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonite-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pull Up
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 2 Basic Pokémon (except for Dragonite-EX) from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Misty's Determination
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: ナッシー[Exeggutor]
data.flavorText: Dr.オーヤマ考案「日米交流カード」パーティ気分で和洋せっちゅう。

attacks.name: ふみつけ[Stomp]
attacks.text: コインを1回投げオモテなら、10ダメージを追加。 Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Surfing Pikachu
data.flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachu was found riding the waves at the local beach.

data.name: Flying Pikachu
data.flavorText: By learning how to fly, Pikachu overcame its weakness to Fighting Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Imakuni?'s Doduo
rules: (This card cannot be used at official tournaments.)

abilities.name: Frenzied Escape
abilities.text: When this Doduo retreats, hold this card and throw it as hard as you can because Doduo is running away. Throw the card horizontally with a snap to get the farthest distance!

attacks.name: Harmonize
attacks.text: From the moment you use this attack, you must begin to sing a song. (While the song is being sung, the game continues.) When the song is finished, this attack does 30 damage.

data.name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: Each player turns all of his or her Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).
